description: The applicant intends to revise the original proposal to include the eastern portion of 5255 North Eraser Way, as well as the property to the north at 5151 North Eraser Way. This will create a larger site with a total area of 11.2ha (27 acres) as compared with the original development site area of 6.03 ha (14.9 acres). The revised development site is intended to accommodate a one-storey light industrial/warehouse development, and as such, a new suitable plan of development is required.

zoning.newZoningCode: CD Comprehensive Development District, M2 General Industrial District, M5 Light Industrial District, M5r Light Industrial District, Big Bend Development Plan, Glenlyon Concept Plan

description: To seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 September 29. The purpose is for a Multiple-Family Infill Development based on RM2 Multiple Family Residential District and Royal Oak Community Plan guidelines. The development plan includes the construction of multiple buildings with non-rental residential units, underground electrical, telephone and cable servicing, stormwater management, and various deposits and charges.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of an above ground electrical room as part of the electrical upgrades of the Metro Vancouver Central Park Pump Station. The site is located within Central Park, near the eastern park entry via Patterson Avenue. The proposed development is in line with the Park and Open Space designation of the Metrotown Downtown Plan.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of a ten-unit category A supportive housing facility. The rezoning is from R5 Residential District to CD Comprehensive Development District, based on the R5 Residential District, and in accordance with the development plan entitled 'Rosewood Seniors Category A Supportive Housing', prepared by NSDAArchitects.

Amendments to Solo District Phase 4 in Brentwood Town Centre Plan. Rezoning from CD Comprehensive Development District to Amended CD Comprehensive Development District. Purpose is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 September 29.
The rezoning is for the construction of a three-storey stacked townhouse development consisting of 124 units, with full underground parking.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to establish development guidelines for the future development of rental townhouses on the subject site, as part of a broader City initiative to develop non-market housing on various City-owned sites in Burnaby.
The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit a government cannabis store within an existing commercial retail unit (CRU).

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit a government cannabis store within an existing commercial retail unit (CRU). The subject site is located within Edmonds Town Centre on the corner of Kingsway and Edmonds Street. Specifically, it is located in two Kingsway-fronting CRUs within the Kings Crossing mixed-use development. The development is comprised of three high-rise apartment towers (28, 31, and 36 storeys), a six-storey office building, a two-storey commercial podium, and six levels of underground parking with access off Edmonds Street and from internal driveways flanking the north and east property lines.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the subject karaoke box room to operate as a liquor primary license establishment. The subject karaoke box room is located at 6681 MacPherson Avenue, on the southwest corner of Kingsway and MacPherson Avenue. The karaoke box room is comprised of the southern CRU, totaling approximately 375.4m^2 (4,041 sq.ft.), within a three unit commercial building zoned C4 Service Commercial District. There are currently three business licenses issued for the property, including two restaurant licenses (the karaoke box room and pizza restaurant) and one retail license. The subject property is located within the Royal Community Plan area and is designated for medium density mixed use development. Commercial developments under the C4 District are located immediately to the west, to the east across MacPherson Avenue and to the north across Kingsway from the subject property. To the south, across Lane Street, are low-rise industrial developments under the M4 Special Industrial District. Vehicular access to the site is from MacPherson Avenue and loading access is from Lane Street.

address: 4500 Dawson Street, 4554 Dawson Street, 2223 Alpha Avenue, Ptn. 2350 Willingdon Avenue
description: The purpose of the rezoning is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 August 25. The recommendation includes the submission of a suitable plan of development, the advancement of the Grove Master Plan, rezoning reference #17-36 to final adoption, and the deposit of sufficient monies including a 4% Engineering Inspection Fee to cover the costs of all services necessary to serve the site and the completion of a servicing agreement covering all requisite services. Other requirements include the installation of all electrical, telephone, and cable servicing, the utilization of an amenity bonus through the provision of a cash in-lieu contribution, the granting of any necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements, and/or covenants, the registration of a Housing Agreement for the non-market component of the proposed development, and compliance with the City's Groundwater Management for Multi-Family Development guidelines.

zoning.previousZoningCode: M1 Manufacturing District, M2 General Industrial District, M5 Light Industrial District
zoning.newZoningDescription: Multiple Family Residential, Rental District, Urban Village Commercial District, Brentwood Town Centre Development Plan

description: To seek authorization for the construction of two three to five storey office buildings with underground parking for the expansion of the Electronic Arts (EA) Burnaby campus.

zoning.newZoningDescription: Comprehensive Development District based on M5 Light Industrial District and M8 Advanced Technology Research District, Discovery Place Community Plan guidelines

description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of a high-rise apartment building with townhouses fronting Olive Avenue. The subject site is roughly rectangular in shape with an approximate lot width of 39.3 m (128.9 ft.), lot depth of 67.2 m (220.5 ft.), and total area of 3,056.9m^2 (32,904.2 sq.ft.). The proposed development aligns with the following goals and sub-goals of the Corporate Strategic Plan: A Connected Community, An Inclusive Community, A Dynamic Community.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of two high-rise apartment buildings with rental podiums and street-oriented townhousing. The maximum density permitted may be up to 8.3 FAR, which includes 5.0 FAR (RM5s), 2.2 FAR (RM5r), 1.1 FAR (Density Offset), subject to conditions set out in the Burnaby Zoning Bylaw, Burnaby Rental Use Zoning Policy, and the approval of Council.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of a single high-rise apartment building with townhouses fronting Wilson Avenue and a live-work street-oriented component fronting Kemp Street. The maximum density permitted may be up to 9.6FAR, which includes 5.0FAR (RM5s), 2.2 FAR (RM5r), 1.1 FAR (Density Offset), and 1.3 FAR (C2), subject to conditions set out in the Burnaby Zoning Bylaw, Burnaby Rental Use Zoning Policy, and the approval of Council.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the installation of a skysign on the southern face of an existing five-storey office building. The proposed skysign will be placed below the fifth floor balcony on the south side of the building and will be visible from Grandview Highway and the Trans-Canada Highway.

zoning.newZoningDescription: based on M5 Light Industrial District

description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the development of non-market housing for women and children, and a child care facility. The proposed plan includes a 60 unit non-market housing project for women and children, a child care facility, and accessory offices. The maximum density for the residential component is 1.1 FAR with full underground parking, and 0.8 FAR for the child care and accessory office component, for a total of 1.9 FAR.

zoning.previousZoningCode: P2 Administration and Assembly and R3 Residential Districts
zoning.previousZoningDescription: Mixed use residential and assembly district

description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the expansion of the existing supportive housing facility. The rezoning application is to facilitate the development of up to 45 additional supportive housing units, as well as a host of support services, on the site for people at risk of homelessness. Although a suitable plan of development has yet to be determined for the site, staff support a maximum density of 1.1 FAR.
To permit the installation of additional rooftop antenna components with surrounding screening and an at-grade equipment compound

urls.title: Rezoning Reference 20-06 Third and Final Memo 2020.0727.pdf

description: To permit the construction of a five-storey apartment building with underground parking, as well as townhouses with surface parking

zoning.newZoningDescription: Permit the construction of a five-storey apartment building with underground parking, as well as townhouses with surface parking

description: The purpose is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28. The recommendations include the preparation and advancement of a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading on 2020 July 06 and to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28 at 5:00 p.m. The sale of City-owned property is also proposed for inclusion within the subject development site.

The purpose of the rezoning is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28. The recommendation includes the preparation and advancement of a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading on 2020 July 06 and to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28 at 5:00 p.m. It also includes the establishment of prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning, such as the submission of a suitable plan of development, the deposit of sufficient monies, the installation of all electrical, telephone, and cable servicing, the utilization of an amenity bonus, the granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements, and/or covenants, the registration of a Housing Agreement and Housing Covenant, the execution of a Tenant Assistance Plan, compliance with the City's Groundwater Management for Multi-Family Development guidelines, the review of a detailed Sediment Control System, the submission of a suitable on-site stormwater management system, the submission of a suitable Solid Waste and Recycling plan, and the design and provision of units adaptable to persons with disabilities.

address: 5895 Barker Avenue, Portion of Olive Avenue ROW and Lane ROW
description: To seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28. The purpose is the introduction of a Highway Closure Bylaw, the sale of City-owned lane, and the establishment of prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning.

The purpose of this rezoning is to seek Council authorization to forward the application to a Public Hearing on 2020 July 28. The proposal includes the development of a High-Rise Strata Tower and Low Rise Non-Market Rental Building. The new zoning code will be CD Comprehensive Development District, based on the RM4s, RM4r Multiple Family Residential District and Metrotown Downtown Plan guidelines.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the renovation and expansion of two existing commercial buildings. The renovation and expansion will include increasing the floor space ratio (FSR) by 20%, adding 50 new hotel units, and adding 100 new non-rental residential units. The buildings will be 10 storeys high.

zoning.previousZoningDescription: Comprehensive Development District based on C3 General Commercial District
zoning.newZoningDescription: Comprehensive Development District based on C3 General Commercial District and Metrotown Downtown Plan guidelines

description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit all commercial uses within the retail portion of the Madison Centre. The rezoning is being pursued to permit general commercial uses under the C3 General Commercial District as a guideline, where currently specific limited uses are permitted under the adopted comprehensive development plan.

zoning.newZoningDescription: Comprehensive Development District with additional guidelines

description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning application is to add architectural LED lighting on the south elevation of two high-rise residential towers that are currently under construction.

behalf: City of Burnaby and School District No. 41
description: The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to formalize the subject properties current use as part of the Parkcrest Elementary School and Park Site, and to facilitate the subdivision and land exchange between the City of Burnaby and the School District.

The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the installation of additional rooftop antenna components with surrounding screening and an at-grade equipment compound. The applicant is seeking to amend the CD Comprehensive Development District plan for the site, and to increase the size of antennae beyond what is identified within Section 6.21 of the Burnaby Zoning Bylaw, in order to permit the installation of nine (9) additional rooftop antenna components, and three (3) additional face-mounted antenna components on the northeast facade. The proposed rooftop antenna installation includes the reconstruction of a 2.7 m (9 ft.) high antennae shroud to screen the existing and proposed antennae. The proposed development proposes an increase in the total antennae area on each building face.

The purpose is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 June 23. The recommendation includes abandoning the predecessor Rezoning Bylaw, preparing and advancing a Rezoning Bylaw to First Reading, and establishing prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning including the submission of a suitable plan of development, deposit of sufficient monies, installation of all electrical, telephone, and cable servicing, utilization of an amenity bonus, dedication of any rights-of-way, granting of necessary statutory rights-of-way, easements, and/or covenants, registration of a Housing Agreement, execution of a Tenant Assistance Plan, review of a detailed Sediment Control System, submission of a suitable on-site stormwater management system, submission of a suitable Solid Waste and Recycling plan, and the design and provision of units adaptable to persons with disabilities.

The purpose is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 June 23. The plan is to rezone from RM3 Multiple Family Residential District to CD Comprehensive Development District, based on the RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, and Metrotown Downtown Plan as guidelines. The proposal includes a high-rise apartment building with townhouses. The predecessor Rezoning Bylaw Amendment No. 16, 2018, Bylaw 13878, will be abandoned contingent upon the granting by Council of Second Reading of the subject Rezoning Bylaw.
The purpose of the proposed rezoning bylaw amendment is to permit the construction of a new 4-storey data centre and office building.

zoning.newZoningDescription: General Industrial District, the Edmonds Town Centre Plan

description: The rezoning is for the introduction of a Highway Closure Bylaw and the establishment of prerequisites to the completion of the rezoning. The purpose is to seek Council authorization to forward this application to a Public Hearing on 2020 June 23. The rezoning is from R5 Residential District to CD Comprehensive Development District based on the RM5s Multiple Family Residential District, RM5r Multiple Family Residential District, and Metrotown Downtown Plan as guidelines.

The rezoning application proposes a high-rise strata apartment building fronting Bennet Street, and a low rise rental apartment podium fronting Lobley Park. The proposed 42 unit rental podium replaces the existing 42 unit low-rise rental building currently occupying the site.

urls.title: Rezoning Reference 16-13 Response to PH Issues 20200420.pdf

description: The proposed development includes a 37 storey market (strata) residential building and a six storey rental residential building. The development replaces an existing 54-unit low-rise rental building currently occupying the site.

urls.title: REZ 17-26 Response to Public Hearing Issues 2020.04.20 2.pdf

description: The rezoning application is for the development of a 43-storey apartment building at the corner of Willingdon Avenue and Maywood Street, townhouses fronting Maywood Street and Cassie Avenue, and a six-storey non-market rental apartment building fronting Willingdon Avenue. The proposed development replaces 92 existing rental units currently on the site.

urls.title: REZ 17-27 Response to Public Hearing Issues 2020.04.20 2.pdf

description: The subject rezoning application proposes a high-rise strata apartment building located on the southern portion of the site and a four storey affordable rental building located on the northern portion of the site, both fronting Marlborough Avenue. The proposed four-storey, 36 unit affordable rental building replaces the existing 36 rental units currently occupying the site.

urls.title: Rezoning Reference 17-30 Response to PH Issues 20200420 2.pdf
